qas.question: What is the largest fellowship without control?
It has been suggested that a primary Baptist principle is that local Baptist Churches are what?
What term is considered somewhat incongrous is a self-governing church?
What is the smallest fellowship without control?

plausible_answers.text: local Baptist Churches are independent and self-governing

qas.question: What has never been suggested as a primary Baptist principle?
What term is not considered to be incongruous?

context: Many Baptist churches choose to affiliate with organizational groups that provide fellowship without control. The largest such group is the <a0_0><b3_0>Southern Baptist Convention<b3_0/><a0_0/>. There also are a substantial number of smaller cooperative groups. Finally, there are <b4_0>Baptist<b4_0/> churches that choose to remain autonomous and independent of any denomination, organization, or association. It has been suggested that a primary Baptist principle is that <b5_0>local Baptist Churches are <a1_0>independent and self-governing<b5_0/><a1_0/>, and if so the term '<a2_0><b6_0>Baptist denomination<b6_0/><a2_0/>' may be considered somewhat incongruous.
